doc.after: The French Republic is a unitary semi-presidential republic with strong democratic traditions.[99] The constitution of the Fifth Republic was approved by referendum on 28 September 1958.[100] It greatly strengthened the authority of the executive in relation to parliament. The executive branch itself has two leaders: the President of the Republic, currently FranÃ§ois Hollande, who is head of state and is elected directly by universal adult suffrage for a 5-year term (formerly 7 years),[101] and the Government, led by the president-appointed Prime Minister, currently Manuel Valls.
